bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frances Wood, September 13, 1940

div1.p: Hench thanks Wood for the newspaper article on Dean and inquires about the camera shop that might have a photograph of the Dean Memorial Bridge.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frances Wood, September 13, 1940
div1.opener:
September 13, 1940
Miss Frances Wood
The Grand Rapids Public Library
Ryerson Library Building
Grand Rapids, Michigan
My dear Miss Wood:
div1.p:
I appreciate very much indeed your real
courtesy in going to so much trouble for me in the matter of
William H. Dean. I particularly appreciate being allowed to
keep the newspaper article. I am sorry you had to spend so
much time searching the post card racks. You are indeed
thoughtful. You say that the Camera Shop may have a photo-
graph which they would sell for fifty cents. If you will
send me the address of the Camera Shop, I will write them
directly. Otherwise, I should appreciate it if you would
phone them, and if they have a photograph which they could
mail me, I will remit promptly. Otherwise, I have a friend
in Grand Rapids who would take a snapshot of it for me.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
